In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

function wrap_string(str, text_width = 10)
    words = split(str) # Split the string into individual words
    wrapped_words = []

    current_word = "" # Current word being processed
    for word in words
        if length(current_word * " " * word) > text_width
            push!(wrapped_words, current_word) # Add the current word to the list of wrapped words
            current_word = word # Start processing a new word
        else
            current_word = current_word * " " * word # Append the current word to the current line
        end
    end

    push!(wrapped_words, current_word) # Add the last word to the list of wrapped words

    return join(wrapped_words, '\n') # Join the wrapped lines into a single string with newline characters
end

# Example usage:
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed aliquam risus eu massa elementum, nec dapibus velit blandit. Quisque tincidunt justo id ligula finibus, non mollis ex pellentesque. Vestibulum ante ipsum primis in faucibus orci luctus et ultrices posuere cubilia curae;"
print(wrap_string(str))
